unnormalised: Dr. Aisha Khan, a renowned cardiologist at AIIMS, New Delhi, was conferred with the "Lifetime Achievement Award" at the annual Indian Medical Association conference held on 10/10/2024. The award recognized her 30+ years of dedicated service and pioneering work in the field of cardiac surgery. Prof. R. K. Sharma of IIT Bombay presented the award, highlighting Dr. Khan's contributions to medical research and her mentorship of countless aspiring doctors.
normalised: Doctor Aisha Khan, a renowned cardiologist at A-I-I-M-S, New Delhi, was conferred with the "Lifetime Achievement Award" at the annual Indian Medical Association conference held on tenth October two thousand and twenty four. The award recognized her thirty plus years of dedicated service and pioneering work in the field of cardiac surgery. Professor R. K. Sharma of I-I-T Bombay presented the award, highlighting Doctor Khan's contributions to medical research and her mentorship of countless aspiring doctors.

unnormalised: The event was attended by several dignitaries, including Mr. Rajesh Kumar, the Health Minister, and Mrs. Priya Verma, the Director of Public Health. In her acceptance speech, Dr. Khan emphasized the importance of accessible healthcare for all, especially in rural India. She also acknowledged the support of her family and colleagues throughout her illustrious career, starting from her early days as a resident at PGI Chandigarh.
normalised: The event was attended by several dignitaries, including Mister Rajesh Kumar, the Health Minister, and Missus Priya Verma, the Director of Public Health. In her acceptance speech, Doctor Khan emphasized the importance of accessible healthcare for all, especially in rural India. She also acknowledged the support of her family and colleagues throughout her illustrious career, starting from her early days as a resident at P-G-I Chandigarh.

unnormalised: Dr. Khan’s dedication also extends to her role as the chairperson for "Healthy Hearts India," an NGO focused on preventive cardiac care. She urged young doctors to embrace innovation and compassion in their practice, stating, "The future of healthcare lies in our ability to blend cutting-edge technology with a deep understanding of our patients' needs." Her address ended with a standing ovation, solidifying her legacy as a beacon of hope and excellence in the medical community.

She urged young doctors to embrace innovation and compassion in their practice, stating, "The future of healthcare lies in our ability to blend cutting-edge technology with a deep understanding of our patients' needs."
